main event: Four to seven times larger than Sputnik, a red, blue-white object was observed in the sky over Beacon, New York on August 18, 1958.
interesting points: The object had a straight course from east to west.
The object was visible for 60-90 seconds before going out of sight behind trees.
The witness was watching the Sputnik satellite transit at the time of the sighting.
Three other people also saw the object.
The report notes the visual sighting is impossible at such a distance, suggesting a possible aircraft sighting.
sighted object: red, blue-white object four to seven times larger than Sputnik
witnesses: one primary witness, three additional witnesses
photographs: no photographs included in the report
